Job SummaryBusiness UnitMeridian Life Science, a segment of Meridian Bioscience, is a first-choice solution provider of innovative immunological and molecular raw materials that accelerate discovery and diagnostic assay development. We are looking for talented and passionate individuals that help drive our vision. Our innovative culture will allow interested candidates to discover and create, through collaboration, novel solutions to tough problems.  Key DutiesJob Description:The Scientist, Protein Sciences position will provide hands-on technical support, within our immunological reagent R&D department, for the development of new products, optimization and improvement of existing products, and the execution of contract manufacturing of custom products. This role will support the improvement and growth of our immunological reagent offerings including recombinant proteins, native/viral antigens, monoclonal antibodies, polyclonal antibodies, blockers, and contract manufacturing. The candidate will be responsible for conducting activities related to vector development, fermentation, protein expression, protein purification, protein characterization, and assay development. Candidate will be responsible for developing and managing our heterologous expression workflow in Escherichia coli, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, and Pichia pastoris. The applicant will be required to work independently at the bench as well as effectively collaborate through communication of scientific findings to internal and external groups as required. Key Duties:Collaborate within multidisciplinary R&D and operational teams to develop new products, improve and optimize existing products, and manufacture custom products in support of our immunological reagent offerings. Design, clone, and optimize constructs that will be used to express proteins in Escherichia coli, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, and Pichia pastoris for commercial manufacturing. Optimize and scale-up protein expression through construct design, understanding fermentation parameters, and media optimization. Characterize microbial cell lines and microbial cell banking including growth, expression, and stability. Develop assays that characterize protein expression and protein quality early in the production workflow.Develop and perform protein purification processes for recombinant proteins, monoclonal antibodies, and polyclonal antibodies. Unit operations include, but are not limited to, preparative centrifugation, depth filtration, tangential flow filtration, chromatographic methods (ion exchange, size exclusion, affinity, etc.). Develop and perform various bio-analytical methods for process monitoring and product characterization. The methods include, but are not limited to, SDS-PAGE, Western Blot, ELISA, spectroscopic methods, HPLC methods. Document and manage experimental methods and results within laboratory notebook. Prepare routine technical progress reports to be shared at internal and external meetings. Help identify new technologies to increase discovery, development, and/or process efficiency. Lead technical transfer of developed procedures to production and/or quality personnel. Includes development of batch records, design of transfer plan, and execution of transfer plan including boots on the ground training. Author batch records and SOPs for transferred/developed processes in compliance with current ISO13485 regulations and company SOPs. Perform routine laboratory maintenance and management including ordering of materials, cleaning and maintenance of laboratory equipment, etc.  QualificationsQualifications:BS, MS, or Ph.D. from an accredited institution in a relevant scientific discipline such as Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, etc. 10+ (BS), 8+(MS), 0-2(Ph.D.) years of relevant research or industrial experience. Extensive hands on experience with cloning, protein expression, and fermentation in microbial systems required. Specific experience with Saccharomyces cerevisiae and Pichia pastoris preferred. Demonstrated ability to purify and characterize proteins through projects or publication record. A knowledge of AKTA Unicorn software preferred. Demonstrated ability to design, document, and execute experiments. Must be able to accurately analyze and interpret generated results. Work effectively in collaborative environment, communicate scientific findings freely, and instruct/ train personnel as required. Open to learn and develop new techniques to support the development and improvement of immunological IVD reagents. Well-organized, able to manage multiple projects, calm under pressure. Proficient in technical writing, concise and accurate oral and written reporting of technical data. Requirements (Physical, Mental, Environmental Demands):Primary work requirements include working in a laboratory setting. Must be able to perform repetitive movements including pipetting and typing. May be required to work outside normal business hours including evenings and/or weekends to support business needs.

OverviewSt. Jude Children’s Research Hospital is seeking a Bioinformatics Research Scientist who is excited to work on the area of functional genomics and proteomics. Recognized for state-of-art computational infrastructure, well-established analytical pipelines, and deep genomic analysis expertise, St. Jude offers a work environment where you will directly impact the care of pediatric cancer patients. As a Bioinformatics Research Scientist, your responsibilities include analyzing data generated from a variety of platforms such as next generation sequencing and mass spectrometry-based proteomics.  The Abraham lab studies gene expression-regulation mechanisms in healthy and diseased mammalian cells. We are recruiting computational biologists to collaborate to develop tools and frameworks to analyze high-throughput sequencing (-omics) data. We build analytical software pipelines to find answers to biological questions about gene regulation in big datasets, usually from applied sequencing experiments like ChIP-Seq, RNA-Seq, and Hi-ChIP. Our interests center on enhancers and super-enhancers, how these regulatory elements establish gene expression programs in healthy cells, and how enhancers are altered, abused, and targetable in diseased cells. Our particular focus is on characterizing the core regulatory circuitries driving disease-relevant cells, and on understanding how mutations in the non-coding DNA of such cells can drive disease, including cancers, through gene misregulation.  Ideal candidates will have experience building analysis pipelines using widely available genomic analysis toolkits (e.g. bedtools, samtools), as well as experience managing large numbers of datasets. The successful candidate will be tasked with collaborative research within and beyond the lab, so strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential. Additional experience in fundamental understanding of gene expression mechanisms (e.g. transcription factors, enhancers, genome structure, and transcriptional condensates), and experience building succinct, clear figures using R are preferred.  The department of Computational Biology provides access to high performance computing clusters, cloud computing environment, innovative visualization tools, highly automated analytical pipelines and mentorship from faculty scientists with experience in data analysis, data management and delivery of high-quality results for competitive projects. We encourage first author, high profile publications to share this element of discovery. Take the first step to join our team by applying now!Minimum EducationPh.D. in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics or related field required Minimum ExperienceWe will consider PhD graduates with strong bioinformatics/computational biology skills.  -OR-  If PhD training did not include bioinformatics research, will require a minimum of two (2) years of pre- or postdoctoral research experience in in computational biology or bioinformatics.  Experience with programming languages such as Perl, Python, R, or Bash required.  Relevant Papers:  Abraham BJ, Hnisz D, Weintraub AS, Kwiatkowski N, Li CH, Li Z, Weichert-Leahey N, Rahman S, Liu Y, Etchin J, Li B, Shen S, Lee TI, Zhang J, Look AT, Mansour MR, Young RA. Small genomic insertions form enhancers that misregulate oncogenes. Nat Commun. 2017 Feb 9;8:14385. doi: 10.1038/ncomms14385. PubMed PMID: 28181482; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC5309821.  Hnisz D, Abraham BJ, Lee TI, Lau A, Saint-André V, Sigova AA, Hoke HA, Young RA. Super-enhancers in the control of cell identity and disease. Cell. 2013 Nov 7;155(4):934-47. doi: 10.1016/j.cell.2013.09.053. Epub 2013 Oct 10. PubMed PMID: 24119843; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC3841062.EEO StatementSt. Jude is an Equal Opportunity EmployerNo Search Firms:St. Jude Children's Research Hospital does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. Please do not call or email. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee or other representative at St. Jude via email, the internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place and approved by HR will result in no fee being paid in the event the candidate is hired by St. Jude.

The Cooperative  Institute for Mesoscale Meteorological Studies (CIMMS) seeks to fill a Social  Scientist Research position for its collaborative research as a Cooperative Institute  with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Office of  Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR) National Severe Storms Laboratory (NSSL)  and the NOAA Weather Forecast Office (WFO) in Norman, Oklahoma. The successful  candidate will lead and conduct end-user-focused research as a part of the  NSSL’s Warn-on-Forecast (WoF) program, and in doing so, serve as the  Warn-on-Forecast liaison between NSSL and the broader NOAA National Weather  Service (NWS) community. Background: The vision of the  WoF program is to develop, test, and transition to operations a probabilistic  storm-scale forecast system with the goal of providing continuous forecast  guidance between the ‘watch-to-warning’ temporal and spatial scales for  hazardous convective weather such as tornadoes, large hail, damaging winds, and  extreme rainfall. An experimental WoF system has recently been developed and is  early in its testing phase.  It is important  that the probabilistic forecast guidance provided by the system is usable and  useful to NWS forecasters and other stakeholders, like broadcast  meteorologists, emergency managers, and others. Social science research  engaging forecasters at operational WFO and other locations is needed to  determine the feasibility of transitioning a WoF system to operations.  Currently we are working mostly with the Norman, OK WFO to test the system’s  usability in an operational environment.  We are looking  for a social scientist interested in expanding the breadth and depth of  research-to-operations studies that engage users at multiple NWS offices and  centers. In particular, we are looking for a social scientist with experience  designing and conducting end-to-end research studies, ideally within the  weather enterprise. These studies will  be aimed at addressing research questions such as: What spatio-temporal  information gaps are most challenging in the generation and delivery of  forecasts? What are forecasters’ baseline interpretations of probabilistic  forecast guidance from ensemble systems? What types of tools, products, and  visualizations are best for the interpretation and use of rapidly updating  probabilistic forecast guidance? Methods for examining these types of questions  may include usability testing experiments, surveys, interviews, focus groups,  and/or observational studies with both forecasters and end-users (i.e.,  broadcast meteorologists and emergency managers). Results from these studies  will provide feedback on how to enhance usability of the WoF system that will  then be used to improve system development. Responsibilities: The incumbent will design and conduct studies within  NOAA NWS offices and centers to explore and test operational usability of the  WoF system. This work will include  aspects such as: 1) visualization of system output, 2) forecasters’  perceptions, understanding, and use of probabilistic forecast guidance and  related uncertainty information, 3) the communication of this information to  partners, and 4) identification of operational opportunities for (or concerns about)  applying probabilistic information within the WFO and broader NWS  infrastructure.  In this role, a primary responsibility of the  incumbent will be to coordinate the experimental use of the WoF system with NWS  leaders. This responsibility includes  traveling to and conducting research within NWS offices and centers as needed.  Throughout the research process, the incumbent will collaborate with other  social scientists, model developers, and stakeholders to contribute toward the  production of a WoF system prototype ready for transfer to operations.  Additional responsibilities include publishing findings in peer-reviewed  literature and presenting at conferences.  To apply for this position, please forward your CV, cover letter and list of three references to:  Tracy  Reinke  Executive  Director, Finance and Operations  University  of Oklahoma, CIMMS  120  David L. Boren Blvd., Suite 2100  Norman, OK 73072-7304  treinke@ou.edu  ATTN: Social Scientist Liaison for Warn-on-Forecast and NWS Required Education: PhD or near completion of a PhD in Cognitive Psychology, Social Psychology, Industrial Engineering/Human Factors Engineering, Communication/Risk Communication, Anthropology/Ethnography, Science and Technology Studies or a related field.Skills:Research experience completing end-to-end exploratory work or experiments in a controlled setting or field setting. Experience should include: generating ideas, designing studies, obtaining IRB approval, conducting studies and analyzing dataAbility to coordinate experimental activities with the NOAA NWS and travel to NWS offices or centers to conduct research as needed.Experience conducting data collection and analysis in a collaborative environment (i.e., observation, user evaluation, etc.). Data analysis experience should include working with both quantitative and qualitative data.Special Instructions: If you are selected as a final candidate for this position, you will be subject to The University of Oklahoma Norman Campus Tuberculosis Testing policy. To view the policy, visit https://hr.ou.edu/Policies-Handbooks/TB-TestingPosition is dependent on passing a Department of Commerce background check.

Spatiotemporal Data Scientist - Proagrica - StillwaterData from precision agriculture is spatial, growing rapidly, and coming from diverse sources. Proagrica's challenge is to connect this data, clean it, and make it queryable, freeing up the creativity of domain experts to convert data into insights. We are looking for a data scientist with experience with spatial data to join a new team tasked with this challenge. This represents an exciting opportunity to join Proagrica and make an immediate impact on a new initiative. Furthermore, Proagrica is part of Reed Business Information, a much bigger data & analytics organization with many opportunities to grow your career. The data science team will consist of data analysts/statisticians and data engineers. The team may also include, as needed, business analysts, architects, and database administrators and programmers. The team will use a hybrid approach, being responsible for a product and collaborating closely with other product teams on data issues. The Spatiotemporal Data Scientist role is based in Oklahoma and will report to the Lead Data Scientist. Responsibilities Participate in the design and implementation of an appropriate spatial query tool. Become deeply familiar with spatial data layers collected in precision agriculture. This will involve interviewing internal stakeholders as well as third party data collectors, reading research articles, and traditional data exploration using code. Increase the completeness and accuracy of data both through post-collection cleaning and by working with other product teams to improve collection. Elicit use cases for the data and facilitate use of the tool by internal teams. Educate internal stakeholders about spatial data layers and appropriate uses, ensuring that data is presented to customers is reliable. Participate in other product teams as a data science resource and communicate their priorities back to the data science team. Requirements Habit of thinking through processes thoroughly, considering all implications, and asking questions when needed Strong applied statistics skills including tests, distributions, maximum likelihood estimators, etc.Strong math skills including linear algebra and multivariable calculus. Extensive experience programming with R, or another statistics language (e.g. Julia) Experience reading, evaluating, and presenting rigorous peer-reviewed research Ability to listen and ask follow-up questions that elicit detailed and actionable user stories Ability to communicate methods and conclusions to both technical and non-technical audiences Ability to think flexibly (on your feet) and creatively about problems and possible solutions using data Preferred Scientific and practical understanding of data layers in agriculture, including how data is generated by users, sensors, and labs Experience with georeferenced data and geostatistics, including trend surface analysis and interpolation methods Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, D3, ggplot) ? Experience programming with F# or C# Experience with query languages and databases (e.g. SQL) Experience with machine vision, particularly of satellite data Experience with OCR Experience with text mining Experience with machine learning (e.g. Bayesian methods, decision trees)About Reed Business Information:Reed Business Information (RBI) provides information, analytics and data to business professionals worldwide. Our strong global products and services hold market-leading positions across a wide range of industry sectors including banking, petrochemicals and aviation where we help customers make key strategic decisions every day. RBI is part of RELX Group plc, a world-leading provider of information solutions for professional customers across industries.http://www.reedbusiness.comRBI General Benefits Package- 401k match of 5% - 18 Days Holiday - Paid Charity Days – 2 days per year  - Benefits start upon hire date - Excellent OTE & Competitive SalariesRBI is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Data Engineer II, Full Time, Informatics, INTEGRIS CorporateJob Code: 7367Position Summary:The Data Engineer II designs and builds enterprise data models in tabular and multi-dimensional formats on Microsoft BI platform from structured and unstructured data sources to meet business data mining and analysis needs. Models and designs data structures to ensure cross enterprise data source integrity, alignment and facility for multi-domain analysis bridging financial, quality, claims and operational data enabling novel analyses and ensuring effective return on data investments across the enterprise. Uses enterprise model data structures to create machine learning APIs for improved alerting, population health segmentation, risk assessment and forecasting throughout the enterprise. Provides direction and guidance and support to junior technical staff.INTEGRIS Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Essential Functions:The Data Engineer II essential functions include but are not limited to:* Prepares executive briefings and presents findings to owning service lines and customers* Architects and implements enterprise data models in tabular and multi-dimensional formats on Microsoft BI platform* Leads enterprise data coordination efforts to champion alignment between enterprise data model efforts and production reporting* Builds analytical self-service tool sets for ease of use self-service BI for end-users enterprise wide* Models data to ensure across enterprise data source integrity, alignment and facility for multi-domain analysis* Incorporates an understanding of human systems engineering to design and implement effective data visualizations for enterprise wide impact* Create machine learning APIs for improved alerting and forecasting across the enterprise* Conducts current state analysis and develops, recommends, and documents customer requirements* Is able to write queries including compile, code, categorize, calculate, tabulate, audit and verification in a source control environment* Provides direction and guidance and support to junior technical staff* Transforms user requirements into logical structured computer program design* Architects advanced analytic systems * Reviews software upgrades and releases and follows established guidelines for system change control* Follows established guidelines for reviewing and resolving incidents, requests, and tasks to ensure high customer engagement and satisfaction* Provides support to staff and vendors as projects move from design and planning to operational status* Supports BI workflows; provides strategic technical and analytical data source assessment of new financial, clinical, or enterprise systems software products to ensure long term viability, alignment and integration with existing analytical tool sets and enterprise data stores* Provides ongoing and regular reviews of incidents, requests, and tasks to ensure high customer engagement and satisfactionAccountability: Reports to the Administrative Director of Provider Informatics, CMIORequired Physical Demands (Subject to Reasonable Accommodation): Keyboarding/Dexterity: Frequently; activity exists from 1/3 to 2/3 of the time Standing/Walking: Occasionally; activity exists up to 1/3 of the time Strength (Lift/Carry/Push/Pull): Light (Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, or up to 10 pounds of force frequently) Talking (Must be able to effectively communicate verbally): Yes Seeing: Yes Hearing: Yes Color Acuity (Must be able to distinguish and identify colors): No This position may have additional or varied physical demand and/or respiratory fit test requirements. Please consult the Physical Demands Project SharePoint site or contact Risk Management/Employee Health for additional information.Environmental Conditions: Normal office environmentPosition may require up to 10> travel to include all INTEGRIS facilitiesAll applicants will receive consideration regardless of membership in any protected status as defined by applicable state or federal law, including protected veteran or disability status.Qualifications:* Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering or mathematics and 6 years of experience in a business related field or MBA or MS in a related field* Previous experience with financial, clinical or web based systems computing preferred* Previous experience in tabular or multidimensional data modeling on the Microsoft platform and experience with data mining with Hadoop clusters* Previous experience working in a source controlled team development environment* SQL, C#, python coding experience required* SAS, R, DAX, pig, hive, and C coding experience preferred* Must be able to communicate effectively in English (verbal/written)* Must obtain Epic certification or proficiency within 6 months of hire* Must obtain MCSA Machine learning certification (exams 70-773/4) within 6 months of hire* Must obtain MCSA BI Development certification (exams 70-767/8) within 12 months of hire* Must maintain Epic certification or proficiency on current version

Scientist / Engineer / Systems Analyst OKC, OK (Job ID # 12882) Tasks required by this position include the ability to perform human factors research activities in accordance with the regulatory agency requirements of the Federal Aviation Administration. The qualified candidate must be a doctorate level (Ph.D.) Industrial/Organizational psychologist with strong human factors applied research experience able to conduct field and laboratory research (i.e., design experiments, implement experimental procedures, troubleshoot, collect data, analyze data, interpret statistical analyses, perform literature reviews, write reports summarizing findings, present work at conferences, etc.). Incumbent will serve as a principal investigator on aviation human factors research projects.  The curriculum of related degrees should include graduate level coursework in areas such as advanced research methods, statistical methods, psychometric theory, multi-level modeling, structural equation modeling, multivariate statistics, as well as core experimental psychology domains including coursework in: engineering psychology, cognition and brain science, human abilities, cognitive psychology, social psychology, industrial/organizational psychology, individual differences; criterion theory and development; job and task analysis; employee selection and placement; performance appraisal; training theory; and work motivation. Coursework/experience in counseling, therapeutic methods, and clinical methods are not applicable and do not apply.  Experience conducting research in human factors, aviation, aerospace, flight deck, advanced vision systems, or simulators is desirable. Applicants must furnish positive evidence of having performed research and produced products from those endeavors. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Work as lead investigator on an assigned project/task with little or no technical direction Serve as a task leader on important, complex, time-sensitive activities Coordinate team activities and participate as a member of a team to:  o Design experiments, implement experimental procedures, and troubleshoot  o Collect data, analyze data, and interpret statistical analyses Perform literature reviews Write reports summarizing findings, present work to research sponsors, peer groups, and at conferences, as required EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Ph.D. in Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Engineering Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Social Psychology, Applied Psychology, Industrial Engineering, or Applied Social Psychology required. Demonstrated experience providing expert research project leadership for highly complex and challenging activities required. Minimum 5 yrs related work experience required. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES Computer software (Microsoft Office) skills required, knowledge of Statistics for the Social Sciences (SPSS) or Statistical Analysis Software (SAS), ability to work independently and as a member of a team required. WORK ENVIRONMENT This position is primarily performed in a climate controlled office setting.  We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, gender identity and sexual orientation. Advises one or more areas, programs or functions and provides recommendations to senior executives on matters of significance, and as an advanced subject matter expert competent to work at very high levels in multiple knowledge and functional areas across the enterprise.  We are seeking a Principle Data Scientistable to  0) have absolute fun with the rest of us,  1) develop right analytical solutions from a diverse repertoire of analytical techniques,  2) apply solutions tool agnostic ,  3) mentor junior talent,  4) challenge & be challenged by the team and leadership.  Principal Data Scientist  The Principal Data Scientist will provide thought leadership on the practical application of machine learning and advanced analytical methods and cultivate a data driven culture across the company. The Principal Data Scientist will collaborate with key business leaders to understand business problems and formulate analytical solutions for problem solving as well as lead or collaborate with a team of data scientists, data analysts or big data engineers on analytical projects, proving benefits of solutions and helping with execution and measurement. Specifically, demonstrated practical experience in building end to end data science solutions and applying machine learning methods to real world problems.Experience with state-of-the-art techniques in machine learning algorithms, including deep neural networks, NLP, dimensionality reduction, ensemble methods, graph algorithms.Strong programming skills in at least one language such as Python, Java, Scala or R.Experience with providing strategic advice and guidance to functional teams in a collaborative fashion; working alongside other analytic individuals and teamsExperience in developing, maintaining, and collecting structured and unstructured data sets for analysis and reportingHas experience with Deep Learning models, AI development, agile software launching, Tensorflow experience, and/or deploying model pipelines across various technologies, such as Kubernetes or Docker.Understanding of hardware to enable various Data Science technologies (i.e. GPU application in Deep Neural Network development)Successful demonstrated experience in working with senior executives to develop and drive segment or enterprise-wide functional strategiesAbility to advise one or more areas, programs or functionsAbility to work at very high levels in multiple knowledge and functional areas across the enterpriseExperience leading and growing junior talentExperience with disrupting or leading a wave of change in their industryPreferred Qualifications3-5+ years project and/or people leadership experienceBig data experience (Hive, Spark, HDFS) a big plus!Experience in GCP, AWS, Azure or other cloud ecosystems.Scheduled Weekly Hours40

Principal Scientist Principal Scientist uses his/her knowledge and experience to pursue product development and R&D goals, supporting the new product and tolling pipeline including synthesis, application / material characterization for these products.  Important qualifications include a commitment to scientific excellence, the ability to design and execute experiments that enable decision making; troubleshooting and solving technical and logistical problems. Principal Scientist will be engaged with process simulations or Design of Experiments approaches, bench top, kilo scale, pilot scale, and kilo-ton scale operators. The successful candidate is expected to network with lead scientists at the other company R&D centers. DESCRIPTIONHumRROs Validity Investigations for Education and the Workplace (VIEW) program is seeking a motivated individual to contribute to the organizations education and workplace research activities. Individual will participate in ongoing studies and serve as a member of a research team. Individual also will participate in expansion of existing contracts and development of new business through proposal writing and business networking. Projects may include, but not be limited to:  Design and implement research and analysis plans;  Conduct classical and IRT item analyses, test scoring and equating, standard setting, and reliability and validity studies for large-scale testing programs;  Develop and use psychometric tools to critically evaluate accuracy of results and decisions made during the operational scoring of tests;  Develop programs using SAS or R to manipulate and merge large data files;  Collect and analyze data gathered through various means (e.g., focus groups, surveys, extant databases)  Write technical reports and orally present project findings.  The position requires knowledge of psychometric measurement, including item response theory, equating, and differential item functioning; experience manipulating, merging, and cleaning large data files through user-written syntax in SAS or R; a strong foundation in applied research design, test construction and validation, methodology and statistics (using SAS, R, and/or SPSS); the ability to ensure technical quality, meet deadlines, and adhere to budgets; strong organizational skills and teamwork skills; and excellent written and oral communication skills.  Candidates should be willing to work on a variety of tasks and projects and possess a desire to learn and develop inventive methods that respond to client needs. Candidates with a doctorate in educational measurement, quantitative psychology, industrial/organizational psychology, or a closely related discipline are preferred; however, those with a masters degree in a relevant discipline and relevant work experience are encouraged to apply.  HumRRO, a nonprofit organization, offers exciting challenges and opportunities in a variety of program areas. We are a national leader in providing customized solutions to issues related to strategic human capital management, program evaluation, educational research, program policy and analysis, and other areas that have broad impact.  All qualified applications will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, medical condition, or disability. EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled.

Job Description SummaryBecton, Dickinson and Company Bioscience Informatics (FlowJo) in Ashland, OR is seeking a highly qualified Application Scientist in the southeast United States to support the Company’s two primary products - FlowJo and SeqGeq. The Application Scientist supports customers, provides technical support, promotes sales, and drives market development through application expertise, field demonstrations and seminars as well as conference presentations.Job DescriptionThe Application Scientist serves as a technical expert in a collaborative effort with our sales team to drive market development, and the conduit of customer needs to engineering development. The position requires significant direct interaction with existing and potential customers, and carries an expectation of 50% travel, predominantly within the southeast United States. Territory spans approximately from South Florida, to Maryland, to the Mississippi River.  We are looking for applicants passionate about science and helping researchers around the world streamline their single cell data analysis, who would like to join a dynamic team of Ph.D. scientists who support and direct our scientific, training, sales, and marketing efforts. If you consider yourself an outlier and would jump at the chance to bring the next generation of single cell research tools to market, please apply.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide high quality support, including customer visits, demonstrations, seminars/workshops, as well as phone, webinar, and email support.Identify and work with researchers to foster new product introduction and acceptance in the scientific community.Partner with Engineering for testing, specifying existing and future software components and assessing development priorities.Travel to key customers and prospects to provide technical consultation, create new demand, assist with sales, increase customer utilization, expand customer networks, and increase awareness.Promote solutions through participation in technical conferences, trade shows, publications, seminars, and symposiums.Participate in application design, documentation, data analysis, and authoring of application notes and white papers.Keep up to date with the scientific community and track major technical/application trends to support improvements in product positioning, selling strategies, and product/workflow development.Participate in industry organizations, committees, and standards organizations; engage with key opinion leaders.Provide technical expertise with regard to potential new markets and applications and support market development, growth, and achievement of sales plan.Provide customer-based technical, market, and application feedback to product management and sales teams to guide strategy development.Report field activities and trends back through written reports and regular meetings.Expected travel will be about 50%, but may exceed. ATTRIBUTES: Team player able to work autonomously on the fieldConstructively skepticalFlexible both in job role and problem solvingHigh level of intensity, tenacity, and results-driven self-motivationNatural, education-focused communication style (written and presentation)Keen interest in technology and its application to specific research trends SKILLS: Demonstrated ability to create demand for new or disruptive technologiesto present high level technical seminarsto build and leverage strong industry networksto understand customer challenges and needs and to present a solutionto troubleshoot problems and find innovative solutionsto use computer science and information technology to solve problems in life science data management, analysis, and visualization REQUIREMENTS: Ph.D. in Cell Biology, Immunology, Hematology, Molecular Biology, or similar field with experience in a lab or technical roleMust have a solid background in biological sciences, immunology, stem cell, or cancer biology with understanding of procedures, concepts and lab experience.5+ years flow cytometry experience.Must be able to travel 50% PREFERRED: Practical experience in using R, Python, Java, C, and/or databases.Practical sales experience, understanding of the sales process and ability to influence customer buying decisions.Ideal candidates will reside in the Southeastern United States, preferably within 60 miles of a major airport. #LI-OPSPrimary Work LocationUSA OR Ashland - FlowJoAdditional LocationsWork Shift

RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Data Analyst in Louisville, Kentucky (KY).  Summary:  The Consultant for Digital Analytics and Insights will be responsible for helping to build and manage client's advanced analytics capabilities in the area of Digital Analytics and Insights. The role will be influential in helping the client understand who its digital customers are, what motivates them, how to grow the digital channel mix, and how to increase customer self-service with client's digital experiences. You will help to develop a deep understanding of the customer and then partner across the DCoE and the Enterprise to identify new and innovative solutions to solve unmet customer needs. This individual must be a skilled analytics leader and influencer. The role will partner across the client with other analysts, IT, and the business.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about data and how it can be leveraged to influence work across all DCoE teams to ensure client's digital solutions start first with the customer in mind, (i.e. are easy to use and represent delightful digital experiences). We are seeking a candidate who can apply a logical, systematic approach to problem solving using statistical/innovative/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to resolve business problems and drive change. The essence of work performed by the Advanced Analytics team involves gathering, manipulating and synthesizing data (e.g., customer behaviors, feedback, channel features, financial attributes, etc.), models and other relevant information to draw conclusions and make recommendations resulting in implementable strategies. As a result of the focus on data gathering, synthesis and analysis, the work efforts will be central to fact-based decision-making.REQUIREMENTS:To be considered for this position, candidates must have experience in a similar role or they must possess significant knowledge, experience, and abilities to successfully perform the responsibilities listed. Relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus.  Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Bioinformatics Scientist responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following :

· Bioinformatics analyses of experimental data produced by NGS.

· Participate in designing and conducting verification and verification studies.

· Development of new bioinformatics analysis/annotation algorithms.

· Support of commercial analysis software.

The ideal candidate would possess :

· Strong previous experience in bioinformatics in a clinical setting.

· Experience with Laboratory Developed Tests (LDT) desirable.

· Experience with New York State LDT validation is a plus.

· Ability to breakdown and clearly define problems.

· Knowledge of genomic terminology.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team - self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude.

· B.S. in bioinformatics, computational biology, or related field with four years of professional bioinformatics work experience in either industry, a clinical laboratory, a research laboratory, or a combination of the three settings. OR Ph.D. in bioinformatics, computational biology, or related field with less than two years professional experience in in either industry, a clinical laboratory, a research laboratory, or a combination of the three settings.

· Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship

Position is full-time, Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m., with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Louisville, KY are encouraged to apply.

Pacific Institute for Research and Evaluation (PIRE) is an independent, nonprofit organization merging scientific knowledge and proven practice to create solutions that improve the health, safety and well-being of individuals, communities, and nations around the world. We have excellent health coverage, retirement opportunities and flexible telecommuting and work arrangements available to support our nationally recognized institution of independent scientists. Opportunity Summary: PIRE is seeking Investigators to join our Center in Louisville, KY. This opportunity is open to senior level investigators – and/or a small team of investigators– who are positioned to substantially contribute to PIRE’s growing drug and drug policy portfolio or other research agenda. We also have positions at our five other locations: We also have positions at our five other locations: Oakland, CA, Albuquerque, NM, Chapel Hill, NC, Providence, RI, and the Calverton Center located in the Washington, DC metropolitan area,. Specifically, we invite letters of introduction from senior level investigators who have:Current funding from NIH, CDC and/or other agencies that fund scientific research,A track record of relevant publications in high impact journals, andStrong skills in research collaboration and management. Successful applicants will be expected to pursue their own research while collaborating with other PIRE scientists in areas of mutual interest. PIRE is prepared to assist researchers submit applications with startup funding, administrative support and collaborative scientific support. Employment is contingent upon successful awards.  PIRE is a soft-money and self-funded research organization. The independence and freedom as a scientist, comes with the responsibility of seeking and securing one’s own funding. Please share your resume along with brief description of your research interest and potential funders.  PIRE has a diverse portfolio of scientific research focusing on alcohol and drug use and their effects on public health and safety. We have a rich blend of NIH, NHTSA, SAMHSA and Foundation funded work focusing on various drugs of abuse, including prescription drugs, marijuana, heroin, methamphetamine and related health and public health problems (e.g. HIV, HCV, overdose, driving fatalities, criminology). We are specifically expanding our drug related research but are not limiting this opportunity. Our scientists examine risk factors and outcomes at both the individual and structural levels, with a focus on informing public policy and/or understanding the specific impacts of policies on health. Our studies employ a diverse range of research methodologies, including qualitative and quantitative methods and a variety of innovative sampling methods. Among these studies are NHTSA- and NIH-funded roadside surveys that are measuring the prevalence of drug use among drivers using biological measures, the effects of marijuana legalization on prevalence among drivers, and the effects of drugs on crash risk.  Anchoring our research portfolio on the west coast is the Prevention Research Center (PRC) in Oakland, CA. PRC is one of 27 centers sponsored by the NIAAA. PRC was formed in 1983 and is the only such center that specializes in the environmental prevention. PRC's focus is on conducting research to understand better the social and physical environments that influence individual behavior that leads to alcohol and drug misuse. Recent PRC drug research includes studies of the geographical distribution of medical marijuana dispensaries as well as effects of decriminalization and legalization of marijuana.  Details of our other Centers can be found at www.pire.org.  PIRE has a strong commitment to research dissemination and moving science to practice and practice to science. The implementation of our work is demonstrated in peer-reviewed journal articles, reports for government and lay audiences and professional presentations. Fuller documentation of PIRE’s corporate capabilities detailing our drug-related work is on our web site (www.pire.org).  We look forward to talking with you about your interests and the fit with PIRE.
Company_Name: Pacific Institute for Research and Evaluation

Bright Cellars (www.brightcellars.com) is the monthly wine subscription startup designed to help new wine drinkers discover and define their taste in wine! We curate wines from around the world with the goal of making wine fun, accessible, and educational.How Bright Cellars works: Our members join the Bright Cellars club by taking a short quiz to share their taste preferences. The Bright Cellars learning algorithm evaluates these preferences to predict four bottles of wine matched to each member’s taste. Each month, our members receive four unique bottles in the mail and log on to our site to provide personalized feedback. Similar to Pandora, the Bright Cellars algorithm uses this feedback to improve monthly matches going forward.Bright Cellars is a fun, fast-growing startup with a work hard, play hard attitude. Position Description:Purpose Supervise and independently perform studies to advance the goals of the principal investigator’s research projects. Innovate solutions to technical MRI application problems, develop prototypes, manage prototype evaluations, and oversee medical/graduate student researchers rotating through the laboratory. Perform experiments, analyze data and compile results and monitor quality control processes to ensure integrity of research. Primary Functions • Design and execute complex research procedures related to MRI application development. These procedures will include software development in C/C++ and Matlab.  • Develop and perform routine and complex protocols for research programs. In addition; manage protype installation, maintenance, and operation in clinical research studies.  • Coordinate research study activities; lead and manage projects.  • Assist in developing, implementing and monitoring quality activities.  • Collaborate with principle investigators in determining study design and performing statistical analyses. Write and submit peer-reviewed journal manuscripts and conference abstracts.  • Perform and develop routine and complex computational and database methods for implementation. Milliman is seeking a Data Scientist to carry out statistical modeling on medical and health insurance data. Join our team-based environment that recognizes individual efforts and contributions. Take the next step in your career at a fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative firm that encourages and supports every employee. ROLE DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES The ideal candidate will be passionate about applying leading edge data science methods, producing customer value, and innovating new solutions. They will continually form hypotheses and seek to validate or invalidate them through data testing. The ideal candidate will work hard and continually seek ways to work smarter, allowing the practice to further rely on data science methods and allowing the candidate room to grow. They will have the tenacity to take loosely defined business problems and apply predictive models with an eye towards quality results.  The Data Scientist will support and/or lead initiatives primarily related to empirical model development, monitoring, maintenance, documentation, and data governance. Specific areas of focus may include but are not limited to the modeling of: risk scores, mortality rates, claim likelihood, disease likelihood, and expected claim costs.  The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing, developing, and improving high quality solutions from simpler statistical profiling to automating deployments of advanced predictive models.  The Data Scientist must be adept at managing competing priorities, advancing multiple projects concurrently, working with project managers, and mentoring junior team members. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE Experience: Requires 3 to 5 years, minimum of 2 years in a data science capacity Interdisciplinary knowledge including finance, mathematics, statistics, and programmingPerform data extraction, transformation, and loading from multiple data sourcesExecute all phases of modeling projects: identifying the potential business problem, data exploration, form hypothesis and recommendations, post implementation monitoringPrinciples and mathematics behind predictive and stochastic modelingProficiency in programming, querying, and statistical tools such as R, Pandas, Python, or SQL.Develop statistical and machine learning methods such as GLM, RF, and GBMKnowledge of distributed computing processing systems (Hadoop/Spark) is recommendedKnowledge of visualization tools such as PowerBI or ShinyKnowledge of a variety of technologies/libraries including Parquet, AWS EMR, LIBSVM, and LightGBMEDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Completion of a Master’s Degree or a Bachelor’s Degree with 4 years of experience in a data science role. Degrees must have a concentration in math, statistics, finance, economics, computer science or related field. COMPETENCIES AND BEHAVIORS THAT SUPPORT SUCCESS IN ROLEStrong communication skills (both verbal and written)Ability to help identify client issues and resources needed to solve problemsAnalytical thinking skills to evaluate analyses for communication to clientsAbility to help plan and organize work for projectsAbility to teach and check work of less experienced staffCan complete project deliverables, meet deadlines, and ensure compliance with quality proceduresStrong time management skillsAbility to work independently and within a teamClient focused and results orientedOrganizational expertise and flexibilityAmbition and excitement for professional developmentSalary: The salary for this position is commensurate with experience and skills.Application: Candidates who upload a resume and cover letter will be given first consideration.Applicants must be presently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. The Milwaukee Health IT Consulting Practice does not sponsor individuals for the purpose of obtaining or maintaining H-1B, O-1, TN, or other nonimmigrant work authorizing status for this position.

Company Name:The Benefit Services Group (BSG) | BSG Analytics LLC (BSGA)Job Title: Data ScientistLocation: Pewaukee, WI  At BSG|BSGA, we service clients nationwide in employee benefits and wellness consulting, and health care analytics. We get to the core of our clients' plan costs, and help them make informed decisions to address them. Our approach is straightforward—reliable, comprehensive data is always the starting point. Our in-depth understanding of what influences behavior and how employees consume health care services allows us to identify a positive, reachable outcome and outline an action plan to get there.  BSG|BSGA has been certified as a Great Place to Work by the Great Place to Work Institute. At BSG|BSGA, you ll enjoy working on a friendly and supportive team where your strengths are valued, your creativity is encouraged, and your contributions are respected.  And because office life is about more than work, we make work-life balance a top priority. Paid Family Leave, flexible scheduling, paid volunteer time, and an on-site fitness center are just some of the ways we ensure that your hard work is acknowledged and sustainable.  We are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our Analytics Department servicing our data warehouse and analytical services clients. The Data Scientist is responsible for analyzing health care cost and utilization data, applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis and creating data models. This includes understanding health care claims, eligibility and pharmacy data and crafting the models to meet client requirements. The Data Scientist will also work in concert with team members within the Analytical Services and Data Research and Analytics Departments. Some of your responsibilities will include: Interact with in-house data management personnel regarding aggregation of data and deployment into Qlikview application and OLAP cubes.  Independently analyze data from various health care plans and programs (including but not limited to medical, pharmacy, dental, vision and wellness data).  Organize, outline, prepare and present reports, executive summaries, data models and/or data analytics-related presentations (collaborating with the communication team, as necessary).  Gather requirements, design experiments, test hypotheses and build models for scenarios that are beneficial to clients and impact vital business processes and decision support.  Correspond directly with internal and external clients (and vendors, if needed) on all data analytics-related matters, e.g. hypothesis testing and statistical validation. This includes in-person, e-mail and phone communication.  Implement appropriate algorithms to discover patterns in data. Qualifications: Bachelor s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems or Actuarial Science  Experience in employee benefits experience/health care analytics preferred  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Proficiency in T-SQL, SQL Server, QlikView, R, and/or Python  Proficiency in data science modeling – AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Neural Networks, Supervised/Unsupervised Learning, Forecasting, Predictive Modeling and Clustering. The Benefit Services Group | BSG Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.We Make it Easy Applying takes less than 2 minutes. No passwords or accounts to register or sign-in for.  You are hired directly by the company – MRA does not make hiring decisions. MRA is a not-for-profit employers association serving over 4,000 companies throughout the upper Midwest. We partner with these companies working directly with their HR department and leadership to hire their talent. We are a direct line to the company, not an agency recruiter.

DescriptionUnder the direction of Manager, Insitutional Research, responsible for the analysis, design, technical development, implementation, and on-going support of administrative and academic information systems. Acts as project leader on data management reporting projects and if necessary coordinates the cross-divisional efforts of a team of management staff and identifies other appropriate resources to most effectively achieve WTCS and MATC information goals and objectives. Participates in in-service training, workshops and other educational activities as required or assigned. Advanced knowledge of software, web design and database systems such as, but not limited to Microsoft - Excel, Word & PowerPoint; Adobe - Pro, Reader & Forms/Survey Monkey; Sharepoint, Dreamweaver, SPSS, ArcGIS, Business Objects, SSDW, ODS, SQL, Informix, Enformer, EMSI Economic Modeling, ImageNow and Ellucian (Datatel) Higher Education. Ability to work independently. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with MATC community and general public. Ability to communicate effectively with students, staff, clients and the general public through both oral and written means. Supervisory ResponsibilitiesNone.

How You'll Make a Difference: Regional management of a highly complex, strategic nursing program consisting of multiple studies and strategic projects. Defines study management processes and standards and establishes targets, benchmarks, and performance measures for study delivery and dissemination. Acts as a primary investigator and/or responsible for consultation on research methods, protocol review, and Institutional Review Board processes. Contributes to select committees and strategic initiatives providing analysis and evidence support for practice changes.  Serves as Principal Investigator or Co-Investigator on research studies.  Leads project teams in developing and implementing research plans and protocols, conducting analyses, and preparing reports, abstracts and manuscripts. Serves as liaison to other scientists/collaborators.  Plans, schedules, prioritizes, and monitors all activities related to protocols. Develops timelines and budgets, and ensures that tasks are completed on time and within budget.  Oversees and monitors research studies and projects and guides research associates and scientists. Assures the validity and reliability of all collected data.  Responsible for communicating the results of laboratory or clinical research in both written and oral form to the research staff, collaborators and at scientific meetings.  Writes and publishes manuscripts aligned with research priorities.  Performs regular scientific literature searches and maintains current and complete literature referencing.  Develops ideas suitable for application for external funding and oversees study design and writes grants to promote internal and external funding for research. What it Will Take:Licenses & Certifications Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the State of WI or Illinois Degrees PhD in Nursing Required Functional Experience Typically requires 7 years of experience in conducting research, with at least 5 years of these being responsible for leading clinical research teams with a proven record of successful research study completion and dissemination of findings. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Expert in the conduct of research methods, proposal development, data analysis, publication and presentation of findings.  Strong analytical thinker able to utilize data to identify practice issues and synthesize evidence to address the proactice issue.  Ability to identify key elements and define detailed protocal/project work and incorporate them in to study plan.  Delivery focused and able to work through the challenges of conducting multi-state research studies or strategic projects.  Expertise in Nursing and research standards  Team Oriented with ability to form high performing teams from sets of diverse team members.  Strong communication skills and tools with demonstrated ability to concisely communiocate with Nursing leaders. Key to establishing goals, milestones, and prioritites, ensuring team members understand work assignements and in communicating project status, risks and issues to senior leadership.  Able to interact on a scientific level with organizational, physician, and external community groups or funders.  Demonstrated effecive organizational and time management skills, professional communications, and conflict resolution skills. Role Summary: The Staff Data Scientist will work in teams addressing statistical, machine learning and data understanding problems in a commercial technology and consultancy development environment. Work with customers to capture data and analytics requirements. Develop, verify, and validate analytics to address customer needs and opportunities. Work alongside software developers and software engineers to translate algorithms into commercially viable products and services. Research Scientist I, Chemical Development in Grafton, WI AMRI provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.  The Research Scientist I, Chemical Development is an integral part of the AMRI team, contributing to our success by performing the synthesis, purification, and identification of chemical intermediates and target compounds.  Join our talented workforce, where a commitment to excellence and a customer focused attitude is everything. We pursue excellence because our work has the power to improve patients’ lives with the pharmaceuticals we develop and manufacture. In this role, you will: · Demonstrate proficiency in synthesizing known compounds efficiently using literature or in-house notebook procedures.  · Under supervisory direction, synthesize new compounds by making appropriate modifications of known methods.  · Modify reaction conditions in order to improve yields.  · Purify synthesized chemicals to an appropriate degree. The scientist will be able to use the full range of chromatographic, crystallization, and distillation techniques.  · Analyze and identify compounds using a good range of modern separation and spectroscopic techniques. This will include interpretation of TLC, HPLC, polarimetry, IR, and NMR spectra of moderate complexity.  · Develop solutions to routine technical problems of limited scope and contributes to the completion of routine technical tasks.Qualifications and background to be successful in this role:Required To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  · Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree with major in chemistry or equivalent industrial experience  · Chemical Hygiene training  · Communication skills - Ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical journals, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies or management. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management.  · Mathematical Skills - Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios and proportions to practical situations.  · Reasoning Ability - Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems. Ability to deal with nonverbal symbolism (formulas, scientific equations, graphs, etc.,) in its most difficult phases. Ability to deal with a variety of abstract and concrete variables. Job Description Position Information  TitleAssociate Research Scientist  DepartmentPharmacology (0719)  LocationUniversity of Arizona Health Sciences Position Summary An Associate Research Scientist position is available immediately in the Mantyh research group in the Department of Pharmacology at the University of Arizona Health Sciences Center. The successful candidate will be a highly self-motivated individual with excellent analytical and communication skills who has an interest in studying the sensory and sympathetic nerves and their involvement in skeletal pain.  Our studies have provided insight into the mechanisms that drive skeletal pain and have led to several new therapies (bisphosphonates, anti-RANKL antibodies and anti-NGF) that have been approved or are in late stage clinical trials. We have active collaborations with other neurobiologists, bone biologists, and cancer researchers who are interested in skeletal pain in that occurs following injury, disease and aging.  Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state and optional retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!  The University of Arizona has been listed by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers in the United States and WorldatWork and the Arizona Department of Health Services have recognized us for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocation services, please .  Accepting a new position is a big life step. We want potential candidates and their families to be able to make informed decisions. Candidates who are considering relocation to the Tucson or Phoenix area, and have been offered an on-site interview, are encouraged to use the free services offered by .Ask your department contact to be introduced to ABRS prior to your visit.  Duties & Responsibilities  The Associate Research Scientist is expected to independently drive a research project, performing all experiments and related analyses, including the following: Design experiments to study the role that sensory and sympathetic nerves play in driving skeletal pain, bone remodeling, cancer growth, and cancer metastasis.Perform high quality imaging, including confocal microscopy and super-resolution microscopy.Collect, analyze, and summarize data for the submission of the scientific manuscripts.Prepare manuscripts for publication.Evaluate and propose future directions based on data generated.Assist PI in writing grants and present data at national and international scientific meetings.Perform routine lab duties and participate in student training. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Minimum QualificationsPhD in Neurobiology, Cell Biology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, or related field.A minimum of three years of successful independent research experience and supervision of these activities is required. Preferred Qualifications In-depth understanding of nerves, glial cells, nerve sprouting and neurotrophic factors.Strong background in high resolution imaging and confocal microscopy.Experience with standard molecular and biochemical techniques. Job Description Position Information  TitleResearch Scientist  DepartmentGeosciences (1205)  LocationMain Campus Position Summary The Department of Geosciences is seeking a Research Scientist in Noble Gas Geochronology and Geochemistry. We seek an experienced and dynamic scientist to help manage and lead a new noble gas mass spectrometry facility with two new sector instruments focusing on 40Ar/39Ar, 4He/3He, 21Ne geo/thermochronology and noble gas isotope analyses of groundwater.  The scientist will lead development of routine and experimental approaches in collaboration with geologists, planetary scientists, and hydrologists at the University of Arizona and collaborating institutions in applications ranging from bedrock and detrital geo/thermochronology, cosmogenic and nucleogenic dating, and meteorite exposure histories. The scientist will be expected to take initiative in establishing robust analytical protocols, co-directing facility development and maintenance, and helping train users. This position is a year to year position contingent on satisfactory performance and funding.  Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, vision, and life insurance; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!  The University of Arizona has been listed by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers in the United States and WorldatWork and the Arizona Department of Health Services have recognized us for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocation services, please .  Duties & Responsibilities  Manage and lead a new noble gas mass spectrometry facility, including installation, maintenance, and operation of mass spectrometers, lasers, furnace, cryogenic, and associated instruments, user training, quality control and report generation, financial management, and pursuit of collaborative and independent research projects.  Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Minimum Qualifications Master's Degree plus two years of related experience or PhD degree is required by the time employee begins job assignment.  Experience with noble gas isotope analyses, mass spectrometry, geo/thermochronology, electronic and instrument interfacing, maintenance, and programming.  Preferred Qualifications  PhD degree in Earth Science, engineering, computer science, chemistry, or related fields. Sion Power, the global leader in the development of a new generation of high-energy, rechargeable lithium batteries for portable power is currently searching for Materials/Polymer Scientist for its research and development facility in Tucson. Will interact and collaborate with other groups and departments within Sion Power and outside laboratories. The position requires method development, experimental design and interpretation of results.Hands-on experience is required in selecting and handling appropriate lab glass-ware and lab equipment for mixing, coating, synthesis and purification of various materials.Desired experience in following techniques and data analysis interpretation: FT-IR, UV-VIS, HPLC, GS-MS, DSC, TGA, Elemental Analyzer, SEM, XRD, Cyclic Voltammetry, Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy.Document conducted experiments, analyze data and test results and prepare technical reports.Know and follow safety practices in all areas of the workplace. Collect and dispose of hazardous waste according to approved standards. REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEPh.D. in Materials Science, Polymer Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or Polymer Processing required. The Applications and Data Manager is responsible for coordinating and managing databases, line of business applications, and other critical systems for the Community Food Bank. The Applications and Data Manager builds on a strong background in data systems and accompanying technologies and languages to support current and future needs at CFB. This will be done in collaboration with other departments and teams that use those systems. Typical assignments include database administration, application support, system design and development, training, and business intelligence. This position does not simply support and maintain systems, but actively helps the organization leverage them to better understand its work, drive change, constantly improve, and also help staff learn how to better use technology on a day-to-day basis. Duties and Responsibilities:TECHNICALMaintains and develops line-of-business applications for CFB.Monitors database systems to maintain a secure, efficient, and resilient application infrastructure.Works with other departments, team members, and outside consultants to advance current systems and identify new opportunities.Acts as an internal software expert for a variety of diverse systems by helping staff and volunteers make the best use of available resources.Serves as an internal problem solver and developer for specialized cases in reporting, development, and system utilization.KNOWLEDGE CENTERUnderstands complex technical ideas, but can communicate them to a diverse audience.Helps to make data and information accessible to staff teams to enable better organizational decisions.Provides training, as needed, in both one-on-one and group settings, to share knowledge/techniques/skills/etc. with staff and volunteers.Serves as a technical expert on the selection of new systems and technologies across CFBs work.Works with and consults with internal teams on best practices in systems, security, software, and databases.GENERALProvides consistent and exemplary customer service to staff, volunteers, board members, partners, and other diverse audiences as required.Understands the CFB mission to be a leader in thinking about how technology can support it.Continually learns and grows as technologies change and develop.Provides help with process design by working with teams to take abstract ideas and goals and help turn them into structured systems and technologies.Requirements (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)TECHNICALStrong background with relational database design concepts, structures, and standards.Demonstrable experience with Microsoft SQL Server administration and T-SQL required. Additional database systems and languages a plus.Experience with Azure administration, monitoring, tuning, and deployments.Strong familiarity with Office 365, or demonstrable ability to learn Office 365 administration quickly.Ability to learn and grasp new software.While it is not expected that candidates would necessarily know CFBs current systems at the point of hire, any familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics NAV, Raisers Edge, PowerApps, Microsoft Teams/SharePoint, DNN Platform, and Power BI is a plus.Familiarity with data warehousing, Power BI, and other business intelligence tools and concepts.Background with web development and related technologies (including HTML, CSS, js, etc.) is a plus.Programming experience particularly with C# and .Net languages is a plus.Experience with security standards and concepts PCI, HIPAA, etc. is beneficial.Experience with SSRS, DAX, and ETL technologies is beneficial.SOCIALAbility to communicate complex technical ideas to a diverse audience.Ability to work with teams and individuals to make better use of their systems, and to advise on improvements to systems.GENERALBachelors or Masters degree (preferred) in MIS, Computer Science, Information Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience.Demonstrable ability to learn new systems/technologies.Training in statistics, analytics, evaluation, and/or business intelligence a plus.Expectation: CFBSA is committed to providing employees with an environment in which the Core Values of Respect, Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Excellence, Innovation, and Social Justice are supported and encouraged.  CFBSA works diligently to maintain a culture of fairness, responsibility, trustworthiness and teamwork to advance our mission: We change lives in the communities we serve by feeding the hungry today and building a healthy, hunger-free tomorrow. The Community Food Bank is a drug and tobacco free work environment. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Senior Cathode Engineer / Scientist  We are a global leader in development of a new generation of high-energy, rechargeable lithium batteries is currently searching for a Senior Cathode Engineer / Scientist to be based at its research and development facility in Tucson, Arizona. Covering two decades of research and development, we have created Licerion® technology that significantly enhances the volumetric and gravimetric capacities and cycle life of rechargeable lithium metal batteries. Licerion® is the future for batteries offering the highest energy density, specific energy and performance.  This position will lead the project to develop cathodes for lithium ion battery systems having world leading high volumetric and gravimetric energy densities based on lithium metal oxide cathodes. The position will require optimization of coating formulations, materials specifications and process development. A qualified applicant will be responsible for developing and specifying new processes to meet cell and battery performance and high rate manufacturing requirements as well as the management of vendors for bidding, procurement, and installation of equipment. The candidate will further evaluate and develop toll coating partners and coordinate coating campaigns. Responsibilities include the development, implementation and management of project plans and capital proposals; project plans to include both short-term and long-term strategic goals. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES A. Develop a cathode manufacturing process for high energy, dense lithium ion cathodes to match our high energy lithium metal anodes. This includes raw material specifications, design and procurement of required equipment and development of mixing, coating, drying and calendaring processes.  B. Establish and document proper procedures for mixing and coating recipes. Train technicians for mixing and coatings of development materials and small production runs.  C. Lead the development of process improvements and raw material improvements. Design experiments and work with the coating group to conduct tests. Review/analyze data from experiments and implement changes based on results to optimize cathode for battery specifications. Present results and development strategy to external powder development partners and toll coaters and direct joint development efforts to achieve cathode performance goals.  D. Develop, implement and manage project plans and capital proposals for cathode development including short-term and long-term strategic goals.  E. Report progress against project plans and on capital proposals to company management. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE Advanced Degree in Material Science, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry or related field (Ph.D. preferred) or equivalent industrial experience. Minimum of 5-10 years of pertinent experience in coating, mixing, milling and dispersion processes for cathode development of battery products. Solid understanding of web handling and defect reduction. Familiar with R&D, IP generation as well as equipment and process development for production scale-up. Thorough understanding of Design of Experiments, SPC and statistical data analysis. SKILLSFluent in English.Excellent communication skills in international R&D environment.Clear and concise presentations of project strategy and updates.Strong analytical and reasoning skills.Flexibility and strong work ethics.PHYSICAL DEMANDS While performing the duties of the job, the employee will be required work in a dry room. Working with potentially hazardous and/or toxic chemicals, with appropriate protective equipment may be required.
